component.text: Click each step to learn how to use the Cisco SDM to configure dynamic NAT.
Configuring NAT on a Cisco ISR Router

Enable NAT Configuration using SDM
Choose Configure>NAT>Basic NAT, then click Launch the selected task.

Choose the interface that connects to the Internet or the ISP.
This interface should have the public registered address assigned to it. Next, select the IP address range of the internal network addresses that should be translated to the public registered address.

Review Configuration
Click Finish, if the configuration is satisfactory.
